intro: Galium decaisnei var. latifolium, commonly known as the broadleaf bedstraw, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and opposite, lanceolate leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically broad and have a slightly hairy surface, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Galium decaisnei var. latifolium thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in forest understories.
